\u201cRoman law influence modern civil l.title: Exploring the Influence of Roman Foundations on Modern Civil Law
\u201cRoman law influence modern civil l.content: During the extensive era of the Roman Republic and Empire, legal developments occurred in stages. Throughout the Republic era (753-31 BCE), the jus civile (civil law) was formulated, primarily through custom or legislation and was solely applicable to Roman citizens. By the mid-third century BCE, the Romans developed jus gentium (law of nations), administered by magistrates and governors to ...

But despite modern advancements, some ancient aqueducts are still functional after 2,000 years—a testament to their brilliant design and durability.
